revised_title: Pyrite Geochemistry and Fossil Preservation in Shales: A Study of Mesozoic Marine Shales
tldr: This article explores the geochemistry of pyrite in marine shales and its role in fossil preservation. It discusses the factors that control pyrite formation, such as the supply of organic matter, sulfate, and iron. The study examines various examples of Jurassic shales and their unique preservation styles, highlighting the importance of collaboration between paleontologists, sedimentologists, and geochemists to extract the maximum information from shale-hosted fossil sites.
